sections.title: The challenge of generic contact center reporting
sections.content: Off-the-shelf contact center software often provides generic reports that don't deeply integrate with your unique business processes or data sources. This leads to time-consuming manual data compilation, incomplete insights, and difficulty in making agile operational decisions. Your contact center is unique, and its performance metrics should reflect that, not be limited by rigid templates. Building a custom solution allows you to integrate data from all relevant systems, including CRM, ticketing, and even internal databases, giving you a truly holistic view of your operations.

sections.title: Why build your own contact center performance dashboard?
sections.content:
For mission-critical operations like contact centers, generic reporting simply isn't enough. Custom-built performance dashboards and reporting applications offer unparalleled advantages:

### Gain a Single Source of Truth
Integrate data from disparate systemsâ€”ACD, CRM, ticketing platforms, even internal databasesâ€”into one unified dashboard. No more toggling between applications or manual data collation. Your custom tool can pull exactly the data you need from wherever it resides.

### Tailored KPIs and Metrics
Every contact center has unique goals. Generic solutions offer standard KPIs like AHT or FCR, but a custom system lets you define, track, and visualize metrics that are truly critical to your business. Whether it's resolution rates for specific product lines, sentiment analysis from call transcripts, or agent proficiency across multiple languages, you decide what matters.

### Real-time Actionable Insights
Move beyond historical reports. A custom dashboard can provide real-time updates, allowing supervisors and managers to identify trends, pinpoint issues, and intervene proactively. Monitor call queues, agent status, and customer sentiment as they happen.

### Complete Data Ownership and Security
Unlike SaaS solutions where your sensitive customer and performance data reside on third-party servers, a Kliv-built application gives you full control. Host your application where you prefer, ensuring compliance with internal security policies and regulatory requirements.

### Future-Proof Scalability
As your contact center grows or its needs evolve, your custom application grows with it. easily add new data sources, introduce new metrics, or expand reporting capabilities without being constrained by vendor roadmaps or expensive upgrades. Your system adapts to you, not the other way around.

### Cost Efficiency in the Long Run
While SaaS platforms demand continuous subscription fees that escalate with usage or features, a custom solution built with Kliv is a one-time investment. This empowers you to allocate resources more effectively, shifting from operational expenditure to capital investment in your own core assets.

## Real-world impact

Custom performance reporting solutions are transforming how contact centers operate:

- **Optimizing Staffing**: Predictive analytics based on historical call volumes and agent availability to optimize shift scheduling.
- **Improving Training**: Identifying agent skill gaps through performance metrics and call monitoring analysis to tailor training programs.
- **Enhancing Customer Experience**: Tracking resolution times, first call resolution, and customer satisfaction scores to proactively address service bottlenecks.
- **Boosting Agent Productivity**: Live dashboards for agents showing their personal KPIs, gamification, and performance against targets.
- **Strategic Decision Making**: Comprehensive executive dashboards correlating contact center performance with overall business outcomes and profitability.

sections.title: Performance dashboard ideas to get you started

items.description: Visualize key agent metrics and individual performance.
items.prompt: Create a live agent performance dashboard that displays Average Handle Time (AHT), First Call Resolution (FCR), Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) scores, and call volume for each agent in real-time, with historical trends.
items.title: Agent Performance Summary

items.description: Monitor call queues, wait times, and service levels.
items.prompt: Build a call queue management system that shows current call volume, average wait time per queue, calls in queue, and service level adherence for the past hour, with alerts for breaches.
items.title: Real-time Queue Monitor

items.description: Analyze customer feedback and sentiment from interactions.
items.prompt: Develop a customer satisfaction analytics tool that processes post-call survey data and sentiment analysis from call transcripts, identifying common themes and correlating them with agent performance.
items.title: Customer Feedback Analyzer

items.description: Track hourly call traffic and identify peak periods.
items.prompt: Design a historical call volume report that breaks down inbound and outbound call counts by hour, day, and week, allowing me to identify peak times and forecast staffing needs.
items.title: Call Volume Analytics

items.description: Identify and track reasons for customer contact.
items.prompt: Create a contact reason analysis report that categorizes calls based on customer query types (e.g., billing, technical support, order status) and tracks the frequency and resolution rates for each category.
items.title: Contact Reason Insights

items.answer: Building a custom contact center performance dashboard with Kliv can take anywhere from a few hours for a basic version to a few days or weeks for a highly complex, integrated system. The AI significantly accelerates the development process.
items.question: How long does it take to build a custom contact center dashboard?

items.answer: No coding experience is required. Kliv's platform allows you to describe your desired dashboard, metrics, and data sources in plain language, and the AI helps generate the application.
items.question: Do I need technical skills or coding knowledge to build this?

items.answer: Yes, a key strength of custom applications built with Kliv is their ability to integrate with diverse data sources. This includes common contact center platforms, CRMs, databases (SQL, NoSQL), APIs, and even flat files (CSV, Excel).
items.question: Can I integrate data from my existing ACD, CRM, and other systems?

items.answer: You own the application and all its components, including the code and the data. You have complete control over deployment, hosting, and data security.
items.question: Who owns the dashboard application and the data once it's built?

items.answer: Building a custom solution is a one-time investment, unlike recurring SaaS subscriptions that can increase with users or features. Over time, custom solutions often prove significantly more cost-effective, especially for specific or evolving needs.
items.question: How does the cost compare to off-the-shelf contact center reporting software?

items.question: Can I modify or expand the dashboard after it's initially built?

items.answer: You define the security protocols. Since you control the hosting environment and data access, you can implement robust security measures tailored to your organization's specific compliance and regulatory requirements, often exceeding generic SaaS offerings.
